intro: Carmichaelia muritai, commonly known as the coastal kōwhai, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is adapted to withstand strong winds and salt spray, making it a hardy species in maritime environments. Carmichaelia muritai plays an important role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for native wildlife.
